tam.method: Top-down approach using the total projected size of the Indian fintech market, calculated from the 2024 base value and projected growth rate.

sources.quote: The fintech market in India was valued at USD 121.4 Billion in 2024... projected to exhibit a CAGR of 17.4% during 2025-2033.

assumptions: SAM is the segment of the Indian fintech market relevant to Multipl's 'save now, buy later' model, focusing on digitally savvy consumers planning discretionary spending.
Assumes the serviceable market consists of the entire WealthTech sector (6%) and a convertible 10% of the Payments sector (5.5%), totaling 11.5% of TAM.
Market segmentation data is based on EY's 2023 fintech revenue breakdown for India.
Represents a realistic market share Multipl can capture in the near term (3-5 years) as an early mover in the 'save now, buy later' niche.
Assumes capturing 1% of the SAM amidst competition from traditional savings, BNPL, and other fintech investment platforms.
Achievability is dependent on successful brand partnerships, go-to-market strategy, and user adoption rates.

delta_vs_deck.notes: Deck not available to compare against.
